title: Account Executive Expert Job at SAP Nigeria
content:
At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Postion: Account Executive Expert
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Role Description


	The Account Executive Expert leads and orchestrates in a team selling environment and, where necessary, works with senior management on assigned or local accounts in a geographic territory.
	The AE helps identify and qualify opportunities; execute account strategy; and generate product, service, and training revenue.
	The AE facilitates and maintains successful relationships with SAP® customers – relationships that are measured by their ability to be referenced and customer satisfaction levels.


Expectations And Tasks
Relationship management:


	Build strong customer relationships by consistently setting realistic expectations early in each sales campaign and meeting or exceeding those expectations through successful execution of the customer engagement model (CEM) at SAP®.
	Facilitate customer satisfaction through proper deployment of appropriate SAP resources to execute the CEM successfully.
	Participate in account transitions to ensure proper and consistent communication with customers and virtual account team members.
	Attend and participate in customer team meetings and communicate regularly with consulting staff to ensure customer satisfaction.
	Maintain successful business relationships with SAP’s strategic partners.


Opportunity management:


	Identify, pursue, and close sales opportunities through successful execution of the CEM.
	Position SAP to win sales opportunities by executing and communicating effective sales strategies.
	Discuss and communicate account strategy routinely with other members of the virtual account team.
	Maintain an accurate and documented customer relationship management (CRM) pipeline of opportunities (prospects and suspects) and provide appropriate communication of such to SAP management.
	Gather knowledge on competitors and how to position SAP solutions effectively against them.
	Leverage and communicate solution maps to broaden the SAP footprint.


Territory management:


	Manage the details of all assigned accounts.
	Maintain an up-to-date recorded inventory of all your named accounts, including opportunities, contacts, and history.
	Strive to grow each new sale into a strong account reference for SAP.
	Seek to expand and strengthen SAP’s presence within each account in the territory by establishing proactive relationships with influential people – within the customer and among third parties.
	Support (through direct and active participation) all SAP promotions and events in the territory, including (but not limited to) SAPPHIRE®, industry solution days, executive events, and industry initiatives.
	Develop an extensive knowledge base of all assigned accounts, including their business profile, key players, application and technology footprint, buying process, compelling events, political environment, and strategies.


Administrative management:


	Provide accurate and timely updates to the CRM forecast pipeline system on an ongoing basis.
	Comply with all SAP personnel, sales, proposal, and contract policies.
	Comply in a timely manner with all time sheet, travel, and expense policies.
	Maintain appropriate levels of involvement in customer issues requiring resolution, including invoices for license fees, maintenance, consulting, and training.


Personal development:


	Develop an individual business plan that includes business and personal goals and objectives; discuss, confirm, and review the plan on an ongoing basis with your manager.
	Continue to build and grow your personal knowledge of industry trends, company product offerings, and general business awareness.
	Review, establish, and implement a personal training plan to facilitate your ongoing growth and professional development at SAP.
	Proactively seek to contribute to SAP’s growth objectives by providing mentoring to new AEs.


Requirements
Work Experence:


	Minimum 5 years of specific experience in Account Managemente


Education And Qualification / Skills And Competencies:


	Bachelor’s degree in engineering or technology from an accredited institutions.

title: PR / Media Director Job at Choice Talents NG
content:
Choice Talents NG is Nigeria’s preferred talents management company. Our goal is to help build successful businesses through effective talent, resource and process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: PR / Media Director

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Job


	We are looking for a very senior editor well-experienced with print, radio and TV media, to manage the public relations responsibilities of an international NGO.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and maintain strong relationships with key media outlets, journalists, and influencers to secure positive press coverage.
	Draft and distribute press releases, media advisories, and pitch materials.
	Respond to media inquiries and coordinate media interviews with company spokespeople.
	Work with senior leadership to develop and execute PR strategies that align with the company’s goals and objectives.
	Establish and maintain a clear and consistent voice for the brand across all communication channels.
	Provide strategic counsel to executives on media interactions and public appearances.
	Oversee the creation of compelling, media-friendly content, ensuring alignment with objectives.
	Plan and coordinate press events, conferences, and other public relations activities.
	Represent the organization at industry events, media interviews, and public speaking engagements.
	Develop and implement crisis communication plans and manage communication during sensitive or critical situations.
	Act as the company’s spokesperson during a crisis, providing clear, timely, and accurate information to the media.
	Write press releases, articles, speeches, blog posts, op-eds, articles, and other communication materials as needed.
	Track media coverage and report on the effectiveness of PR campaigns and media outreach.
	Analyze trends in media coverage and public opinion to adapt strategies and improve outcomes.
	Lead and mentor junior PR team members, providing guidance and support in their professional development.
	Collaborate with marketing, social media, and other internal teams to ensure cohesive and effective communication strategies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Public Relations, Communications, Journalism, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
	15+ years of experience in public relations, with a focus on media relations and corporate communications.
	Proven track record of developing and executing successful PR campaigns and securing positive media coverage.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling narratives.
	Strong media relationships with local, national, and trade press.
	Experience in crisis communication and handling sensitive issues.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application to: jobs@choicetalents.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Human Resource Officer Job at Greengrass Investment Limited
content:
Greengrass Investment Limited (GGI) is an emerging player in the Nigerian Extractive Industry with over 3 years of business excellence and mining operations, head-quartered in Keffi, Nasarawa State, Nigeria. GGI strives to make significant contributions to Nigeria's social-economic and industrial development while also focusing on nurturing and developing the local community.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Warra, Ngaski LGA - Kebbi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dedicated Human Resource Officer to join our dynamic mining operations team in Kebbi state, North-West Nigeria. 
	In this role, you will work along other HR professionals, Outsourcing firms and Consultants to manage key HR functions on-site and ensure the seamless delivery of HR services that support our fast-paced project environment. 
	This position requires immediate resumption, so we encourage only qualified and interested candidates to apply.


Key Responsibilities


	
	Talent Sourcing & Recruitment:

	
		Conduct headhunting and talent sourcing for key roles.
		Oversee the recruitment and selection process, ensuring compliance with Nigerian Labour Laws and employment contracts.
		Manage the entire employment life-cycle (Recruitment-Offboarding).
	
	
	
	Employee Relations, On-boarding & Off-boarding:

	
		Manage employee relations to foster a positive work environment.
		Coordinate effective onboarding processes to integrate new hires smoothly.
		Interface with department heads to resolve any issues that may arise.
		Manage termination processes effectively and efficiently to ensure all parties are mutually satisfied with the process.
	
	
	
	Industrial Relations:

	
		Serve as a liaison for industrial relations, ensuring adherence to legal standards and harmonious workplace practices.
		Lead the proposal to ensure the organization is a great place to work.
	
	
	
	Compensation & Benefits:

	
		Administer compensation, benefits, and performance management systems in alignment with company policies.
		Carry out payroll computation for both temporary and permanent workers that is compliant with statutory obligations (PAYE, Pension, ITF, NSITF, etc).
	
	
	
	HR Administration:

	
		Maintain accurate HR records and utilize HIRS (Human Resource Information System) for data management.
		Ensure policies and procedures meet legal requirements and best practices.
	
	


Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, Public Administration, or a related Social Science discipline.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in an HR role, with proven expertise in the areas mentioned above.
	Prior experience in a production facility will be an added advantage.
	Proficiency with HR software systems, particularly HIRS.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian Labour Laws and employment contracts.
	Proven training in HR Fundamentals.
	Must be adaptable to working on-site at our project location and ready to resume immediately.
	Willingness to relocate; company accommodation and a relocation subsidy are provided.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

What We Offer:


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Company-provided accommodation at the project site.
	Monthly Airtime and Data allowances
	Opportunities for professional growth and development in a challenging, fast-paced environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Resume to: hr.greengrassnigeria@gmail.com using the Job Position (HR Officer) as the subject of the email.

Note


	This is a field-based position, therefore candidates will be expected to stay at the company provided accomodation at our project site in Libata, Kebbi State. 
	Due to the urgency of this position, application will be reviewed on a rolling basis and the position may be filled before therecruitment closing date.

title: Business Development Manager Job at JC International
content:
JC International provides World Class specialist Asset Integrity Assurance and Training services throughout the Asset life-cycle.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:  Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos

About The Job


	JC International is seeking a highly driven and strategic Business Development Manager with strong leadership skills to spearhead business initiatives, build lasting client relationships, and drive revenue expansion.


Responsibilities
As the Business Development Manager (BDM), you will be responsible for:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead and mentor the business development team
	Identify and secure high-value business opportunities
	Develop and execute strategic growth plans
	Build and maintain strong client and industry relationships
	Tracking, analysing, and communicating key quantitative metrics and business trends as they relate to partner relationships.
	Establishing new accounts by developing and expanding sales through client visits/telephone inquiries/email and electronic communication
	Selling and generating revenue for the JC International Service offerings
	Conducting market research to evaluate gaps, opportunities, and clients’ needs
	Developing marketing and sales strategy to increase revenue
	Meeting with potential clients and growing long-lasting relationships by understanding their needs
	Ensuring Business expansion and increase in market share index through networking and effective marketing.
	Working with the digital marketing team to showcase the service in the limelight
	Preparing presentations and pitches for prospective Clients & Regulators
	Ensuring prompt response to client’s requests and accurate billing/invoicing.
	The prompt renewal of running contracts Ensure vendor registration with key clients
	Ensuring prompt and seamless mobilization to sites for job call-out
	For the company’s business processes & regulatory compliance, tender preparation, packaging, and timely submission.
	Participating in setting Sales budgets for the division Support the company’s realization of its corporate mission.


Requirements


	BEng. or BSC in any field
	At least 10 years of work experience in sales and business development
	Proven experience in business development, sales, or a related field
	Strong leadership and team management skills
	Strong negotiation skills.
	Strong communication and presentation skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@jcinternationalng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
